title: Identify Features of Ancient Civilizations
question: Create an interactive diagram game where students identify defining features of ancient civilizations from descriptions: Mesopotamia (cuneiform writing, ziggurats, Code of Hammurabi), Egypt (hieroglyphics, pyramids, papyrus), Indus Valley (planned cities, advanced drainage, standardized weights), and China (oracle bones, Great Wall, silk production), clicking on the correct civilization for each described feature.

blueprint.title: Ancient Civilizations: Legacy Unveiled
blueprint.subject: History
blueprint.narrativeIntro: Embark on an archaeological expedition to uncover the unique legacies of ancient civilizations. Your mission: identify the defining features that set Mesopotamia, Egypt, Indus Valley, and China apart.
blueprint.completionMessage: Expedition complete! You've successfully identified and categorized the distinct features of the ancient world's greatest civilizations.

diagram.assetPrompt: A detailed historical map of the ancient world, clearly delineating the geographical regions of Mesopotamia, Egypt, Indus Valley, and China. The map should have an aged, parchment-like texture, with subtle topographical details like rivers and mountains. The four key civilization regions must be visually distinct and easily clickable.

config.instruction_text: Explore the ancient world map. Read the description of an ancient feature, then click on the corresponding civilization's region on the map that developed it.

feedback.on_correct: That's correct! You've successfully matched this feature to its civilization.
feedback.on_incorrect: Not quite. This feature belongs to a different civilization. Re-examine the description for clues about its unique characteristics.
feedback.on_completion: Outstanding! You've successfully identified all the features and their corresponding ancient civilizations on the map!

misconceptions.message: It's easy to think that ancient civilizations had similar developments, but each culture, shaped by its environment and beliefs, often created unique features. For example, cuneiform writing is distinct from hieroglyphics.

While ancient, these civilizations were incredibly advanced! Features like sophisticated urban planning or monumental engineering demonstrate high levels of organization and technological skill, far from primitive.

It's impressive to think about the scale of these ancient constructions! Many monumental features, like the pyramids or ziggurats, were actually built over centuries, involving multiple generations and rulers, showcasing immense societal effort.

config.instruction_text: Now, without the map, sort these unearthed features into their correct ancient civilization categories. Drag each artifact fragment to its matching civilization's display case to solidify your knowledge.

feedback.on_correct: Excellent! That feature belongs to this ancient civilization.
feedback.on_incorrect: Not quite. Consider the unique characteristics and geographical context of this feature. It belongs to a different ancient civilization.
feedback.on_completion: Fantastic work! You've successfully categorized the key legacies of ancient civilizations.

misconceptions.message: While some broad themes exist, each civilization developed unique features (e.g., cuneiform vs. hieroglyphics) shaped by their distinct environment and culture.
Civilizations like the Indus Valley had advanced urban planning and drainage, and Egypt built monumental structures, demonstrating high levels of engineering and societal organization.
Many monumental features were built over centuries, involving multiple rulers and generations, reflecting long-term societal efforts and continuous development.
